title: How to Troubleshoot a Samsung TV That Turns On By Itself

steps.title: Open the Settings.
steps.content: Open the Settings. Use the remote to navigate. This will vary depending on the model, but it should be represented by a cog icon. You can check your TV's event log history for its power-on reason.

steps.title: Select Support.
steps.content: Select Support . This will typically be in the left side panel.

steps.title: Select About this TV.
steps.content: Select About this TV . You can find this at the bottom of the Support menu.

steps.title: Select Event logs.
steps.content: Select Event logs . A new window will open with detailed activity of your TV.

steps.title: Locate "Power-on Reason".
steps.content: Locate "Power-on Reason". This will be under the Event logs header. You'll see the date and time before Power-on Reason followed by the reason.

steps.title: Troubleshoot the reason.
steps.content: Troubleshoot the reason. The solutions will vary depending on the reason. [1] X Research source Here are some common reasons and their solutions: Power-on Reason, YouTube : Some apps, such as YouTube, can use a connected device to turn the TV on. Disable Bluetooth on your connected devices. Power-on Reason, Sensor : Ambient Mode is automatically detecting brightness through the sensor. To turn off Ambient Mode, select Ambient on the remote. Select Settings , and then select Ambient Off Timer to set a time to turn off. Power-on Reason, WOL : Wake-on LAN is enabled on your Windows computer. To disable Wake-on-LAN, open a device connected with your TV, such as a Windows computer. Go to Control Panel → System → Power → Wake-on-LAN → Disable . Power-on Reason, BLE : Paired Bluetooth devices may have a wake-up function. Check for and disable the wake-up function on all devices paired with the TV by Bluetooth. CEC Command, Source enabled : The Consumer Electronics Control feature allows you to turn on HDMI-connected devices using one remote control, which may affect your TV. To disable the CEC feature, go to Settings → General → External Device Manager → disable Anynet+ (HDMI-CEC) .

steps.title: Check the remote for debris.
steps.content: Check the remote for debris. Sometimes, foreign matter can get wedged into the space around the power button. This could cause the TV to turn on by itself.

steps.title: Remove the batteries.
steps.content: Remove the batteries. This will allow you to work safely.

steps.title: Wipe down the remote.
steps.content: Wipe down the remote. Use rubbing alcohol and a microfiber cloth to safely clean the remote.

steps.title: Use a toothpick to scrape around the power button.
steps.content: Use a toothpick to scrape around the power button. Do this at an angle so debris falls outwards rather than into the remote.

steps.title: Reinsert the batteries.
steps.content: Reinsert the batteries. Once the remote has been cleaned, it's ready to be used again.

steps.title: Open the Settings.
steps.content: Open the Settings. Use the remote to navigate. This will vary depending on the model, but it should be represented by a cog icon. This method will reset the TV back to its original settings.

steps.title: Select General.
steps.content: Select General . This will typically be in the left side panel.

steps.title: Select Reset.This will be at the very bottom.
steps.content: Select Reset .This will be at the very bottom. You may need to scroll down to find it.

steps.title: Enter the PIN number.
steps.content: Enter the PIN number. If you didn't change this number when setting up your TV, it should be 0000. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Select Yes.
steps.content: Select Yes . The factory reset will begin. It may take a few minutes to finish. The TV will turn off when it's complete.

steps.title: Turn on the TV.
steps.content: Turn on the TV. You'll need to set up your TV again. The factory reset should fix any errors caused by the settings.

steps.title: If the problem persists, contact Samsung.
steps.content: If the problem persists, contact Samsung. You can get helped from trained technicians in the following ways: Visiting a service center Live Chat, Email, WhatsApp Calling General Support
